b9acb5df457f56156060d93d0827b8ac (01:13): This is because these headers aren't assigned any heading information from the scope algorithm

b9acb5df457f56156060d93d0827b8ac (01:14): and HTML 4 says "In the absence of header information from either the scope or headers attribute, user agents may construct header information according to the following algorithm"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:14): how would Day 2 get Day 1? Day 1 has an explicit scope...
b9acb5df457f56156060d93d0827b8ac (01:15): From the implicit algorithm.

b9acb5df457f56156060d93d0827b8ac (01:15): I think it's an incorrect reading of the HTML 4 spec, but I don't know what the right reading is.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:16): I'm not sure why you think there's absense of scope or headers attribute
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:17): I suppose I need something like <th scope=rowgroup colspan=4 headers>Day x</th> to override the Location, Height, ... headings

b9acb5df457f56156060d93d0827b8ac (01:17): Because, at the moment, my implementation assumes that ""In the absence of header information from either the scope or headers attribute" applies to the cell we are trying to assign a heading to
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:17): assuming <th headers> works like that

b9acb5df457f56156060d93d0827b8ac (01:18): in the case of the <th> cell containing "Day 2" there is no information from any scope or headers attribute that assigns heading information to that cell
b9acb5df457f56156060d93d0827b8ac (01:19): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: But does HTML 4 actually say that?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:19): not sure

b9acb5df457f56156060d93d0827b8ac (01:20): My reading is that if a cell has no heading information supplied from headers or scope you then do the row/column search ignoring scope or headers attributes
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (01:20): this is the case in the HTML5 algorithm though
b9acb5df457f56156060d93d0827b8ac (01:20): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: agreed
